mapper.insert: insert into "public"."requirements_column" (guid, requirements_id, table_id, column_id, operator, sample_data, description, create_time, update_time, delete) values (#{guid,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{requirementsId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{tableId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{columnId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{operator,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{sampleData,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{description,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{createTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, #{updateTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, #{delete,jdbcType=SMALLINT})

update "public"."requirements_column"

table_id = #{tableId,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
column_id = #{columnId,jdbcType=VARCHAR},

where guid = #{guid,jdbcType=VARCHAR}

update "public"."requirements_column" set requirements_id = #{requirementsId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, table_id = #{tableId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, column_id = #{columnId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, operator = #{operator,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, sample_data = #{sampleData,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, description = #{description,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, create_time = #{createTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, update_time = #{updateTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, delete = #{delete,jdbcType=SMALLINT} where guid = #{guid,jdbcType=VARCHAR}
mapper.select: select ci.column_name, rc.operator, rc.sample_data, rc.description from requirements_column rc join column_info ci on ci.column_guid=rc.column_id where rc.requirements_id=#{requirementId} and delete=0
